00060 /*****************************************************************************\
00061  * NOTICE OF CONVENTION                                                      *
00062  * ------------------------------------------------------------------------- *
00063  * Mspec links to Pcode, Hcode, and Lcode modules.  In order to allow this   *
00064  * to take place without requiring front-end modules to link to liblcode.a,  *
00065  * Mspec code is divided into two classes as follows:                        *
00066  *  - mi_*.c must not depend on linkage to liblcode.a                        *
00067  *  - ml_*.c may depend on linkage to liblcode.a                             *
00068 \*****************************************************************************/

00078 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00079 #define M_SPARC_SIZE_VOID       0
00080 #define M_SPARC_SIZE_BIT        1
00081 #define M_SPARC_SIZE_CHAR       8
00082 #define M_SPARC_SIZE_SHORT      16
00083 #define M_SPARC_SIZE_INT        32
00084 #define M_SPARC_SIZE_LONG       32
00085 #define M_SPARC_SIZE_FLOAT      32
00086 #define M_SPARC_SIZE_DOUBLE     64
00087 #define M_SPARC_SIZE_POINTER    32
00088 #define M_SPARC_SIZE_UNION      -1
00089 #define M_SPARC_SIZE_STRUCT     -1
00090 #define M_SPARC_SIZE_BLOCK      -1
00091 #define M_SPARC_SIZE_MAX        64
00092 
00093 #define M_SPARC_ALIGN_VOID      -1
00094 #define M_SPARC_ALIGN_BIT       1
00095 #define M_SPARC_ALIGN_CHAR      8
00096 #define M_SPARC_ALIGN_SHORT     16
00097 #define M_SPARC_ALIGN_INT       32
00098 #define M_SPARC_ALIGN_LONG      32
00099 #define M_SPARC_ALIGN_FLOAT     32
00100 #define M_SPARC_ALIGN_DOUBLE    64
00101 #define M_SPARC_ALIGN_POINTER   32
00102 #define M_SPARC_ALIGN_UNION     -1      /* depends on the field */
00103 #define M_SPARC_ALIGN_STRUCT    -1
00104 #define M_SPARC_ALIGN_BLOCK     -1
00105 #define M_SPARC_ALIGN_MAX       64
00106 
00107 #define M_SPARC_SMALL_STRUCT_MAX 128
00108 
00109 
00110 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00111 #define M_SPARC_MAX_FNVAR_REG   6
00112 #define M_SPARC_PARAM_FP_OFFSET (17 * 4 * 8)    /* 17 longwords in bits... */
00113 #define MIN_PARAM_SIZE \
00114         ((M_SPARC_MAX_FNVAR_REG * M_SPARC_SIZE_INT) + M_SPARC_PARAM_FP_OFFSET)
00115 
00116 #define M_SPARC_IN_BASE         0
00117 #define M_SPARC_RET_IN          0
00118 #define M_SPARC_OUT_BASE        6
00119 #define M_SPARC_RET_OUT         6
00120 #define M_SPARC_RET_F           12      /* %f0 & %f1 */
00121 /* #define M_SPARC_RET_F2       13 *//* %f0 & %f1 */
00122 #define M_SPARC_ST              14      /* the hidden param */
00123 /*#define M_SPARC_ST_IN         15*//* different to be safe */

00125 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00126 /*
00127  *      The following functions are for documentation only.
00128  *      The function overhead is too great for actual usage.
00129  */
00130 void
00131 M_sparc_void (M_Type type)
00132 {
00133   type->type = M_TYPE_VOID;
00134   type->unsign = 1;
00135   type->align = M_SPARC_ALIGN_VOID;
00136   type->size = M_SPARC_SIZE_VOID;
00137   type->nbits = 0;
00138 }
00139 
00140 void
00141 M_sparc_bit_long (M_Type type, int n)
00142 {
00143   type->type = M_TYPE_BIT_LONG;
00144   type->unsign = 0;
00145   type->align = M_SPARC_ALIGN_BIT;
00146   type->size = n * M_SPARC_SIZE_BIT;
00147   type->nbits = n * M_SPARC_SIZE_BIT;
00148   M_assert ((n <= 32),
00149             "M_bit_long: do not allow bit field of more than 32 bits");
00150 }
00151 
00152 void
00153 M_sparc_bit_int (M_Type type, int n)
00154 {
00155   type->type = M_TYPE_BIT_INT;
00156   type->unsign = 0;
00157   type->align = M_SPARC_ALIGN_BIT;
00158   type->size = n * M_SPARC_SIZE_BIT;
00159   type->nbits = n * M_SPARC_SIZE_BIT;
00160   M_assert ((n <= 32),
00161             "M_bit_int: do not allow bit field of more than 32 bits");
00162 }
00163 
00164 void
00165 M_sparc_bit_short (M_Type type, int n)
00166 {
00167   type->type = M_TYPE_BIT_SHORT;
00168   type->unsign = 0;
00169   type->align = M_SPARC_ALIGN_BIT;
00170   type->size = n * M_SPARC_SIZE_BIT;
00171   type->nbits = n * M_SPARC_SIZE_BIT;
00172   M_assert ((n <= 16),
00173             "M_bit_long: do not allow bit field of more than 16 bits");
00174 }
00175 
00176 void
00177 M_sparc_bit_char (M_Type type, int n)
00178 {
00179   type->type = M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR;
00180   type->unsign = 0;
00181   type->align = M_SPARC_ALIGN_BIT;
00182   type->size = n * M_SPARC_SIZE_BIT;
00183   type->nbits = n * M_SPARC_SIZE_BIT;
00184   M_assert ((n <= 8),
00185             "M_bit_char: do not allow bit field of more than 8 bits");
00186 }

00193   type->align = M_SPARC_ALIGN_FLOAT;
00194   type->size = M_SPARC_SIZE_FLOAT;
00195   type->nbits = M_SPARC_SIZE_FLOAT;

00208 void
00209 M_sparc_pointer (M_Type type)
00210 {
00211   type->type = M_TYPE_POINTER;
00212   type->unsign = 1;
00213   type->align = M_SPARC_ALIGN_POINTER;
00214   type->size = M_SPARC_SIZE_POINTER;
00215   type->nbits = M_SPARC_SIZE_POINTER;
00216 }

00218 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00219 
00220 int
00221 M_sparc_eval_type (M_Type type, M_Type ntype)
00222 {
00223   switch (type->type)
00224     {
00225     case M_TYPE_VOID:
00226       M_void (ntype);
00227       return -1;                /* can not be evaluated */
00228     case M_TYPE_BIT_LONG:
00229     case M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR:
00230     case M_TYPE_CHAR:
00231     case M_TYPE_SHORT:
00232     case M_TYPE_INT:
00233     case M_TYPE_LONG:
00234     case M_TYPE_POINTER:
00235     case M_TYPE_BLOCK:
00236       /* the starting address of array is used */
00237       M_int (ntype, type->unsign);
00238       return M_TYPE_INT;
00239     case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
00240       M_float (ntype, type->unsign);
00241       return M_TYPE_FLOAT;
00242     case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
00243       M_double (ntype, type->unsign);
00244       return M_TYPE_DOUBLE;
00245     case M_TYPE_UNION:
00246     case M_TYPE_STRUCT:
00247       *ntype = *type;
00248       return type->type;
00249     default:
00250       return -1;
00251     }
00252 }
00253 
00254 int
00255 M_sparc_eval_type2 (M_Type type, M_Type ntype)
00256 {
00257   switch (type->type)
00258     {
00259     case M_TYPE_VOID:
00260       M_void (ntype);
00261       return -1;                /* can not be evaluated */
00262     case M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR:
00263     case M_TYPE_CHAR:
00264       M_char (ntype, type->unsign);
00265       return M_TYPE_CHAR;
00266     case M_TYPE_SHORT:
00267       M_short (ntype, type->unsign);
00268       return M_TYPE_SHORT;
00269     case M_TYPE_BLOCK:
00270     case M_TYPE_INT:
00271       /* the starting address of array is used */
00272       M_int (ntype, type->unsign);
00273       return M_TYPE_INT;
00274     case M_TYPE_BIT_LONG:
00275     case M_TYPE_LONG:
00276       M_long (ntype, type->unsign);
00277       return M_TYPE_LONG;
00278     case M_TYPE_POINTER:
00279       M_pointer (ntype);
00280       return M_TYPE_POINTER;
00281     case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
00282       M_float (ntype, type->unsign);
00283       return M_TYPE_FLOAT;
00284     case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
00285       M_double (ntype, type->unsign);
00286       return M_TYPE_DOUBLE;
00287     case M_TYPE_UNION:
00288     case M_TYPE_STRUCT:
00289       *ntype = *type;
00290       return type->type;
00291     default:
00292       return -1;
00293     }
00294 }
00295 
00296 int
00297 M_sparc_call_type (M_Type type, M_Type ntype)
00298 {
00299   switch (type->type)
00300     {
00301     case M_TYPE_VOID:
00302       M_void (ntype);
00303       return -1;                /* can not be evaluated */
00304     case M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR:
00305     case M_TYPE_CHAR:
00306       M_char (ntype, type->unsign);
00307       return M_TYPE_CHAR;
00308     case M_TYPE_SHORT:
00309       M_short (ntype, type->unsign);
00310       return M_TYPE_SHORT;
00311     case M_TYPE_BIT_LONG:
00312     case M_TYPE_INT:
00313     case M_TYPE_LONG:
00314     case M_TYPE_POINTER:
00315     case M_TYPE_BLOCK:
00316       /* the starting address of array is used */
00317       M_int (ntype, type->unsign);
00318       return M_TYPE_INT;
00319       /* BCC - don't promote float to double now - 8/5/96 */
00320     case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
00321       /* BCC - 1/15/97
00322        * Always promote floats to doubles because M_sparc_fnvar_layout requires
00323        * that and I don't know how to fix M_sparc_fnvar_layout yes.
00324        */
00325       /*
00326          M_float(ntype, type->unsign);
00327          return M_TYPE_FLOAT;
00328        */
00329     case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
00330       M_double (ntype, type->unsign);
00331       return M_TYPE_DOUBLE;
00332     case M_TYPE_UNION:
00333     case M_TYPE_STRUCT:
00334       *ntype = *type;
00335       return type->type;
00336     default:
00337       return -1;
00338     }
00339 }
00340 
00341 int
00342 M_sparc_call_type2 (M_Type type, M_Type ntype)
00343 {
00344   switch (type->type)
00345     {
00346     case M_TYPE_VOID:
00347       M_void (ntype);
00348       return -1;                /* can not be evaluated */
00349     case M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR:
00350     case M_TYPE_CHAR:
00351       M_char (ntype, type->unsign);
00352       return M_TYPE_CHAR;
00353     case M_TYPE_SHORT:
00354       M_short (ntype, type->unsign);
00355       return M_TYPE_SHORT;
00356     case M_TYPE_BLOCK:
00357     case M_TYPE_INT:
00358       /* the starting address of array is used */
00359       M_int (ntype, type->unsign);
00360       return M_TYPE_INT;
00361     case M_TYPE_BIT_LONG:
00362     case M_TYPE_LONG:
00363       M_long (ntype, type->unsign);
00364       return M_TYPE_LONG;
00365     case M_TYPE_POINTER:
00366       M_pointer (ntype);
00367       return M_TYPE_POINTER;
00368       /* BCC - don't promote float to double now - 8/5/96 */
00369     case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
00370       /* BCC - 1/15/97
00371        * Always promote floats to doubles because M_sparc_fnvar_layout requires
00372        * that and I don't know how to fix M_sparc_fnvar_layout yes.
00373        */
00374       /*
00375          M_float(ntype, type->unsign);
00376          return M_TYPE_FLOAT;
00377        */
00378     case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
00379       M_double (ntype, type->unsign);
00380       return M_TYPE_DOUBLE;
00381     case M_TYPE_UNION:
00382     case M_TYPE_STRUCT:
00383       *ntype = *type;
00384       return type->type;
00385     default:
00386       return -1;
00387     }
00388 }

00390 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00391 void
00392 M_sparc_array_layout (M_Type type, int *offset)
00393 {
00394   *offset = 0;                  /* assume first element is aligned */
00395 }
00396 
00397 int
00398 M_sparc_array_align (M_Type type)
00399 {
00400   return type->align;
00401 }
00402 
00403 int
00404 M_sparc_array_size (M_Type type, int dim)
00405 {
00406   int mod, size, align;
00407   size = type->size;
00408   align = type->align;
00409   mod = size % align;
00410   if (mod != 0)
00411     size += (align - mod);
00412   return (size * dim);
00413 }
00414 
00415 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00416 void
00417 M_sparc_union_layout (int n, _M_Type * type, int *offset, int *bit_offset)
00418 {
00419   int i;
00420   for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
00421     {                           /* assume the union is aligned */
00422       offset[i] = 0;
00423       bit_offset[i] = 0;
00424     }
00425 }
00426 
00427 int
00428 M_sparc_union_align (int n, _M_Type * type)
00429 {
00430   int i, max;
00431   max = 0;
00432   for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
00433     {
00434       int aln = type[i].align;
00435       if (aln > max)
00436         max = aln;
00437     }
00438   /*
00439    *    align to at least byte boundary.
00440    */
00441   if (max < M_SPARC_ALIGN_CHAR)
00442     max = M_SPARC_ALIGN_CHAR;
00443   return max;
00444 }
00445 
00446 int
00447 M_sparc_union_size (int n, _M_Type * type)
00448 {
00449   int i, aln, max_size, max_align;
00450   max_size = 0;
00451   max_align = 0;
00452   for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
00453     {
00454       int size;
00455       size = type[i].size;
00456       if (size > max_size)
00457         max_size = size;
00458       aln = type[i].align;
00459       if (aln > max_align)
00460         max_align = aln;
00461     }
00462   /*
00463    *    align to at least byte boundary.
00464    */
00465   if (max_align < M_SPARC_ALIGN_CHAR)
00466     max_align = M_SPARC_ALIGN_CHAR;
00467   /* need to increment to the max. align for future array extension */
00468   i = max_size % max_align;
00469   if (i != 0)
00470     max_size += (max_align - i);
00471   return max_size;
00472 }
00473 
00474 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00475 void
00476 M_sparc_struct_layout (int n, _M_Type * type, int *base, int *bit_offset)
00477 {
00478   int i, offset;
00479   int mod, size, align;
00480   int mod_word, mod_type;
00481 
00482   offset = 0;                   /* assume initially aligned */
00483   for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
00484     {
00485       size = type[i].size;
00486       align = type[i].align;
00487       M_assert ((size != 0) && (align != 0),
00488                 "M_struct_layout: void is not allowed in structure");
00489       /*
00490        *  need to treat bit fields specially.
00491        *  keep them in a word when possible.
00492        */
00493       if ((i != 0) &&
00494           (type[i].type != M_TYPE_BIT_LONG) &&
00495           (type[i].type != M_TYPE_BIT_SHORT) &&
00496           (type[i].type != M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR))
00497         {
00498           if (type[i - 1].type == M_TYPE_BIT_LONG)
00499             {
00500               mod = offset % M_SPARC_ALIGN_INT;
00501               if (mod != 0)
00502                 offset += (M_SPARC_ALIGN_INT - mod);
00503             }
00504           else if (type[i - 1].type == M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR)
00505             {
00506               mod = offset % M_SPARC_ALIGN_CHAR;
00507               if (mod != 0)
00508                 offset += (M_SPARC_ALIGN_CHAR - mod);
00509             }
00510         }
00511 
00512       mod_word = offset % M_SPARC_SIZE_INT;
00513       if (type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR)
00514         {
00515           if ((mod_word + size) > M_SPARC_SIZE_INT)
00516             offset += (M_SPARC_SIZE_INT - mod_word);
00517           else
00518             {
00519               mod_type = offset % M_SPARC_SIZE_CHAR;
00520               if ((mod_type + size) > M_SPARC_SIZE_CHAR)
00521                 {
00522                   /* fprintf(stdout,"Changing bit char to bit short\n"); */
00523                   type[i].type = M_TYPE_BIT_SHORT;
00524                 }
00525             }
00526         }
00527       if (type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_SHORT)
00528         {
00529           if ((mod_word + size) > M_SPARC_SIZE_INT)
00530             offset += (M_SPARC_SIZE_INT - mod_word);
00531           else
00532             {
00533               mod_type = offset % M_SPARC_SIZE_SHORT;
00534               if ((mod_type + size) > M_SPARC_SIZE_SHORT)
00535                 {
00536                   /* fprintf(stdout,"Changing bit short to bit long\n"); */
00537                   type[i].type = M_TYPE_BIT_LONG;
00538                 }
00539             }
00540         }
00541       else if (type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_LONG)
00542         {
00543           if ((mod_word + size) > M_SPARC_SIZE_INT)
00544             offset += (M_SPARC_SIZE_INT - mod_word);
00545         }
00546       mod = offset % align;     /* align to what the field */
00547       if (mod != 0)             /* needs to start from */
00548         offset += (align - mod);
00549 
00550       if (type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR)
00551         {
00552           int mod = offset % M_SPARC_SIZE_INT;
00553 
00554           bit_offset[i] = offset - mod + (M_SPARC_SIZE_INT - mod - size);
00555           base[i] = offset & (~(M_SPARC_SIZE_CHAR - 1));
00556 #if 0
00557           fprintf (stderr, "type = %d, base = %d, bit_offset = %d\n",
00558                    type[i].type, base[i], bit_offset[i]);
00559 #endif
00560         }
00561       else if (type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_SHORT)
00562         {
00563           int mod = offset % M_SPARC_SIZE_INT;
00564 
00565           bit_offset[i] = offset - mod + (M_SPARC_SIZE_INT - mod - size);
00566           base[i] = offset & (~(M_SPARC_SIZE_SHORT - 1));
00567 #if 0
00568           fprintf (stderr, "type = %d, base = %d, bit_offset = %d\n",
00569                    type[i].type, base[i], bit_offset[i]);
00570 #endif
00571         }
00572       else if (type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_LONG)
00573         {
00574           int mod = offset % M_SPARC_SIZE_INT;
00575 
00576           bit_offset[i] = offset - mod + (M_SPARC_SIZE_INT - mod - size);
00577           base[i] = offset & (~(M_SPARC_SIZE_LONG - 1));
00578 #if 0
00579           fprintf (stderr, "type = %d, base = %d, bit_offset = %d\n",
00580                    type[i].type, base[i], bit_offset[i]);
00581 #endif
00582         }
00583       else
00584         {
00585           base[i] = offset;
00586           bit_offset[i] = 0;
00587 #if 0
00588           fprintf (stderr, "type = %d, base = %d, bit_offset = %d\n",
00589                    type[i].type, base[i], bit_offset[i]);
00590 #endif
00591 
00592         }
00593 
00594       offset += size;           /* allocate space */
00595     }
00596 }
00597 
00598 int
00599 M_sparc_struct_align (int n, _M_Type * type)
00600 {
00601   int i, max;
00602   max = 0;
00603   for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
00604     {
00605       int aln = type[i].align;
00606       if (aln > max)
00607         max = aln;
00608     }
00609   /*
00610    *    align to at least byte boundary.
00611    */
00612   if (max < M_SPARC_ALIGN_CHAR)
00613     max = M_SPARC_ALIGN_CHAR;
00614   return max;
00615 }
00616 
00617 int
00618 M_sparc_struct_size (int n, _M_Type * type, int struct_align)
00619 {
00620   int i, offset;
00621   int mod, size, align, max_align;
00622   int mod_word;
00623   offset = 0;                   /* assume initially aligned */
00624   max_align = 0;
00625   for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
00626     {
00627       size = type[i].size;
00628       align = type[i].align;
00629       M_assert ((size != 0) && (align != 0),
00630                 "M_struct_layout: void is not allowed in structure");
00631       if (align > max_align)
00632         max_align = align;
00633       /*
00634        *  need to treat bit fields specially.
00635        *  keep them in a word when possible.
00636        */
00637       mod_word = offset % M_SPARC_SIZE_INT;
00638       if (type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR)
00639         {
00640           if ((mod_word + size) > M_SPARC_SIZE_INT)
00641             offset += (M_SPARC_SIZE_INT - mod_word);
00642           if (M_SPARC_ALIGN_CHAR > max_align)
00643             max_align = M_SPARC_ALIGN_CHAR;
00644         }
00645       else if (type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_SHORT)
00646         {
00647           if ((mod_word + size) > M_SPARC_SIZE_INT)
00648             offset += (M_SPARC_SIZE_INT - mod_word);
00649           if (M_SPARC_ALIGN_SHORT > max_align)
00650             max_align = M_SPARC_ALIGN_SHORT;
00651         }
00652       else if (type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_LONG)
00653         {
00654           if ((mod_word + size) > M_SPARC_SIZE_INT)
00655             offset += (M_SPARC_SIZE_INT - mod_word);
00656           if (M_SPARC_ALIGN_LONG > max_align)
00657             max_align = M_SPARC_ALIGN_LONG;
00658         }
00659 
00660       mod = offset % align;
00661       if (mod != 0)
00662         offset += (align - mod);
00663       offset += size;
00664     }
00665   /*
00666    *    align to at least byte boundary.
00667    */
00668   if (max_align < M_SPARC_ALIGN_CHAR)
00669     max_align = M_SPARC_ALIGN_CHAR;
00670   /* enforce max. alignment */
00671   mod = offset % max_align;
00672   if (mod != 0)
00673     offset += (max_align - mod);
00674   return offset;
00675 }
00676 
00677 int
00678 M_sparc_layout_fnvar (List param_list, char **base_macro, int *pcount,
00679                      int purpose)
00680 {
00681   M_Param param;
00682   M_Type type;
00683   long int *offset;
00684   int *mode;
00685   int *reg;
00686   int *paddr;
00687   int *su_sreg;
00688   int *su_ereg;
00689   int cnt, i, size;
00690 
00691   cnt = List_size (param_list);
00692 
00693   type = alloca (cnt * sizeof (_M_Type));
00694   offset = alloca (cnt * sizeof (long int));
00695   mode = alloca (cnt * sizeof (int));
00696   reg = alloca (cnt * sizeof (int));
00697   paddr= alloca (cnt * sizeof (int));
00698   su_sreg = alloca (cnt * sizeof (int));
00699   su_ereg = alloca (cnt * sizeof (int));
00700 
00701   List_start (param_list);
00702   i = 0;
00703   while ((param = (M_Param) List_next (param_list)))
00704     {
00705       type[i++] = param->mtype;
00706     }
00707 
00708   size = M_sparc_fnvar_layout (cnt, type, offset, mode, reg, paddr,
00709                                base_macro, su_sreg, su_ereg, pcount,
00710                                0, purpose);
00711 
00712   List_start (param_list);
00713   i = 0;
00714   while ((param = (M_Param) List_next (param_list)))
00715     {
00716       param->offset = offset[i];
00717       param->mode = mode[i];
00718       param->reg = reg[i];
00719       param->paddr = paddr[i];
00720       param->su_sreg = su_sreg[i];
00721       param->su_ereg = su_ereg[i];
00722       i++;
00723     }
00724 
00725     return size;
00726 }
00727 
00728 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00729 int
00730 M_sparc_fnvar_layout (int n, _M_Type * type, long int *offset, int *mode,
00731                       int *reg, int *paddr, char **macro,
00732                       int *su_sreg, int *su_ereg,
00733                       int *pcount, int is_st, int purpose)
00734                                         /* need to return structure */
00735 {
00736   int i, max_align, off, rg, rg_base = 0;
00737   int size, align, mod, tp;
00738 
00739   switch (purpose)
00740     {
00741     case M_GET_FNVAR:
00742       rg_base = M_SPARC_IN_BASE;
00743       *macro = "$IP";
00744       break;
00745     case M_PUT_FNVAR:
00746       rg_base = M_SPARC_OUT_BASE;
00747       *macro = "$OP";
00748       break;
00749     case M_DONT_CARE_FNVAR:
00750     default:
00751       /*
00752          rg_base = 1000000;
00753          *macro = "NoBaseMacro";
00754        */
00755       M_assert (0, "M_fnvar_layout: unknown purpose");
00756 
00757     }
00758 
00759   max_align = M_SPARC_ALIGN_MAX;
00760   rg = 0;
00761   off = M_SPARC_PARAM_FP_OFFSET;
00762 
00763   for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
00764     {
00765       tp = type[i].type;
00766       switch (tp)
00767         {
00768         case M_TYPE_CHAR:
00769         case M_TYPE_SHORT:
00770         case M_TYPE_INT:
00771           if (rg < M_SPARC_MAX_FNVAR_REG)
00772             {
00773               mode[i] = M_THRU_REGISTER;
00774               reg[i] = rg + rg_base;
00775               rg++;
00776             }
00777           else
00778             {
00779               mode[i] = M_THRU_MEMORY;
00780               reg[i] = -1;
00781             }
00782           break;
00783 
00784         case M_TYPE_UNION:
00785         case M_TYPE_STRUCT:
00786           if (rg < M_SPARC_MAX_FNVAR_REG)
00787             {
00788               mode[i] = M_INDIRECT_THRU_REGISTER;
00789               reg[i] = rg + rg_base;
00790               rg++;
00791             }
00792           else
00793             {
00794               mode[i] = M_INDIRECT_THRU_MEMORY;
00795               reg[i] = -1;
00796             }
00797           break;
00798 
00799         case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
00800           if (rg < M_SPARC_MAX_FNVAR_REG)
00801             {
00802               mode[i] = M_THRU_REGISTER;
00803               reg[i] = rg + rg_base;
00804               rg += 2;
00805             }
00806           else
00807             {
00808               mode[i] = M_THRU_MEMORY;
00809               reg[i] = -1;
00810             }
00811           break;
00812 
00813         default:
00814           M_assert (0, "M_fnvar_layout: argument is not promoted");
00815         }
00816 
00817       if ((tp == M_TYPE_UNION) || (tp == M_TYPE_STRUCT))
00818         {
00819           /* for the pointer to the structure */
00820           size = M_SPARC_SIZE_POINTER;
00821           align = M_SPARC_ALIGN_POINTER;
00822         }
00823       else
00824         {
00825           size = type[i].size;
00826           align = type[i].align;
00827           align = (align <= 32) ? align : 32;   /* doubles not aligned 
00828                                                    -- AARGH */
00829         }
00830 
00831       mod = off % align;
00832       if (mod != 0)
00833         off += (align - mod);
00834 
00835       /* since we're big endian... */
00836       if (size < M_SPARC_SIZE_INT)
00837         off += (M_SPARC_SIZE_INT - size);
00838 
00839       offset[i] = off;
00840       off += size;
00841     }
00842 
00843   /* The param section must be at least certain size.
00844    * This is the backing store for the parameter regs. */
00845   if (off < MIN_PARAM_SIZE)
00846     off = MIN_PARAM_SIZE;
00847 
00848   /* the param section must be max. aligned */
00849   mod = off % max_align;
00850   if (mod != 0)
00851     off += (max_align - mod);
00852 
00853   /* now for the body of the structures... small ones first. */
00854   for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
00855     {
00856       tp = type[i].type;
00857 
00858       size = type[i].size;
00859 
00860       if (((tp == M_TYPE_UNION) ||
00861            (tp == M_TYPE_STRUCT)) && (size <= M_SPARC_SMALL_STRUCT_MAX))
00862         {
00863 
00864           align = M_SPARC_ALIGN_MAX;    /* must align to a double boundry */
00865 
00866           mod = off % align;
00867           if (mod != 0)
00868             off += (align - mod);
00869 
00870           paddr[i] = off;
00871           off += size;
00872         }
00873     }
00874 
00875   /* now large ones */
00876   for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
00877     {
00878       tp = type[i].type;
00879 
00880       size = type[i].size;
00881 
00882       if (((tp == M_TYPE_UNION) ||
00883            (tp == M_TYPE_STRUCT)) && (size > M_SPARC_SMALL_STRUCT_MAX))
00884         {
00885 
00886           align = M_SPARC_ALIGN_MAX;    /* must align to a double boundry */
00887 
00888           mod = off % align;
00889           if (mod != 0)
00890             off += (align - mod);
00891 
00892           paddr[i] = off;
00893           off += size;
00894         }
00895     }
00896 
00897   /* the param section must be max. aligned */
00898   mod = off % max_align;
00899   if (mod != 0)
00900     off += (max_align - mod);
00901 
00902   return off;                   /* the total size needed */
00903 }
00904 
00905 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00906 int
00907 M_sparc_lvar_layout (int n, _M_Type * type, long int *offset,
00908                      char **base_macro)
00909 {
00910   int i, max_align, off;
00911   int size, align, mod, tp;
00912   /*
00913    *    the LOCAL section must be max. aligned initially
00914    */
00915   max_align = M_SPARC_ALIGN_MAX;
00916   off = 0;
00917   for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
00918     {
00919       tp = type[i].type;
00920       if (tp == M_TYPE_BIT_LONG)
00921         {
00922           M_assert (0, "M_lvar_layout: bit field not allowed");
00923         }
00924       if (tp == M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR)
00925         {
00926           M_assert (0, "M_lvar_layout: bit field not allowed");
00927         }
00928       size = type[i].size;
00929       align = type[i].align;
00930       mod = off % align;
00931       if (mod != 0)
00932         off -= (align + mod);
00933       off -= size;
00934       offset[i] = off;
00935     }
00936   /* the local section must be max. aligned */
00937   mod = off % max_align;
00938   if (mod != 0)
00939     off -= (max_align + mod);
00940   /*
00941    *    Local variables are relative to $LV
00942    */
00943   *base_macro = "$LV";
00944   return -off;                  /* the total size needed */
00945 }
00946 
00947 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00948 int
00949 M_sparc_no_short_int (void)
00950 {
00951   return (M_SPARC_SIZE_SHORT == M_SPARC_SIZE_INT);
00952 }
00953 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00954 void
00955 M_sparc_cb_label_name (char *fn, int cb, char *line, int len)
00956 {
00957   sprintf (line, "Lcb%d%s", cb, fn);
00958 }
00959 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00960 int
00961 M_sparc_is_cb_label (char *label, char *fn, int *cb)
00962 {
00963   return (sscanf (label, "Lcb%d%s", cb, fn) == 2);
00964 }
00965 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00966 void
00967 M_sparc_jumptbl_label_name (char *fn, int tbl_id, char *line, int len)
00968 {
00969   sprintf (line, "%s%s%d", fn, M_JUMPTBL_BASE_NAME, tbl_id);
00970 }
00971 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00972 /* Format for sparc is: %sM_JUMPTBL_BASE_NAME%d, where %s is the func name  */
00973 int
00974 M_sparc_is_jumptbl_label (char *label, char *fn, int *tbl_id)
00975 {
00976   char *ptr;
00977   int label_len, fn_len, base_len;
00978 
00979   /* Some length checks, to make sure we dont step outside array */
00980   label_len = strlen (label);
00981   fn_len = strlen (fn);
00982   base_len = strlen (M_JUMPTBL_BASE_NAME);
00983   if (label_len <= (fn_len + base_len))
00984     return (0);
00985 
00986   /* Check that fn is correct */
00987   ptr = label;
00988   if (strncmp (ptr, fn, fn_len))
00989     return (0);
00990 
00991   /* Check that jumptbl base name is correct */
00992   ptr += fn_len;
00993   if (strncmp (ptr, M_JUMPTBL_BASE_NAME, base_len))
00994     return (0);
00995 
00996   /* Get the id */
00997   ptr += base_len;
00998   return (sscanf (ptr, "%d", tbl_id) == 1);
00999 }
01000 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01001 int
01002 M_sparc_structure_pointer (int purpose)
01003 {
01004   return M_SPARC_ST;
01005 }
01006 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01007 int
01008 M_sparc_return_register (int type, int purpose)
01009 {
01010   switch (type)
01011     {
01012     case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
01013     case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
01014       return M_SPARC_RET_F;
01015     default:
01016       switch (purpose)
01017         {
01018         case M_GET_FNVAR:
01019           return M_SPARC_RET_OUT;
01020         case M_PUT_FNVAR:
01021           return M_SPARC_RET_IN;
01022         case M_DONT_CARE_FNVAR:
01023         default:
01024           return -1;
01025         }
01026       /*return M_SPARC_RET_IN; */
01027     }
01028 }

01055 /*
01056  *  Declare code generator specific macro registers to the front end parser.
01057  */
01058 void
01059 M_define_macros_sparc (STRING_Symbol_Table * sym_tbl)
01060 {
01061 
01062   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "g0", L_SPARC_MAC_ZERO);
01063   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "g1", L_SPARC_MAC_G1);
01064   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "icc", L_SPARC_MAC_ICC);
01065   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "icc0", L_SPARC_MAC_ICC0);
01066   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "icc1", L_SPARC_MAC_ICC1);
01067   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "icc2", L_SPARC_MAC_ICC2);
01068   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "icc3", L_SPARC_MAC_ICC3);
01069   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "icc4", L_SPARC_MAC_ICC4);
01070   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "icc5", L_SPARC_MAC_ICC5);
01071   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "icc6", L_SPARC_MAC_ICC6);
01072   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "icc7", L_SPARC_MAC_ICC7);
01073   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "icc8", L_SPARC_MAC_ICC8);
01074   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "icc9", L_SPARC_MAC_ICC9);
01075   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "icc10", L_SPARC_MAC_ICC10);
01076   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "icc11", L_SPARC_MAC_ICC11);
01077   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "icc12", L_SPARC_MAC_ICC12);
01078   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "icc13", L_SPARC_MAC_ICC13);

01080   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "icc15", L_SPARC_MAC_ICC15);
01081   /* 1 if leaf function, 0 if non-leaf */

01090   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "fcc", L_SPARC_MAC_FCC);
01091   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "fcc0", L_SPARC_MAC_FCC0);
01092   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "fcc1", L_SPARC_MAC_FCC1);
01093   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "fcc2", L_SPARC_MAC_FCC2);
01094   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "fcc3", L_SPARC_MAC_FCC3);
01095   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "fcc4", L_SPARC_MAC_FCC4);
01096   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "fcc5", L_SPARC_MAC_FCC5);
01097   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "fcc6", L_SPARC_MAC_FCC6);
01098   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "fcc7", L_SPARC_MAC_FCC7);
01099   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "fcc8", L_SPARC_MAC_FCC8);
01100   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "fcc9", L_SPARC_MAC_FCC9);

01119 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01120 int
01121 M_sparc_fragile_macro (int macro_value)
01122 {
01123   switch (M_model)
01124     {
01125     case M_SPARC_ELC:
01126     case M_SPARC_VIKING:
01127       switch (macro_value)
01128         {
01129         case L_MAC_SP:
01130         case L_MAC_FP:
01131         case L_MAC_LV:
01132         case L_MAC_IP:
01133         case L_MAC_OP:
01134         case L_MAC_LOCAL_SIZE:
01135         case L_MAC_PARAM_SIZE:
01136         case L_MAC_SWAP_SIZE:
01137           return 0;
01138         default:
01139           return (1);
01140         }
01141     default:
01142       M_assert (0, "M_sparc_fragile_macro:  Illegal model specified!");
01143       return (0);
01144     }
01145 }
01146 
01147 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01148 Set M_sparc_fragile_macro_set ()
01149 {
01150   switch (M_model)
01151     {
01152     case M_SPARC_ELC:
01153     case M_SPARC_VIKING:
01154       return NULL;
01155     default:
01156       M_assert (0, "M_sparc_fragile_macro_set:  Illegal model specified!");
01157       return (0);
01158     }
01159 
01160 }
01161 
01162 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01163 int
01164 M_sparc_dataflow_macro (int id)
01165 {
01166   switch (M_model)
01167     {
01168     case M_SPARC_ELC:
01169     case M_SPARC_VIKING:
01170       return ((id >= L_MAC_P0 && id <= L_MAC_P64) || (id >= L_MAC_LAST));
01171     default:
01172       M_assert (0, "M_sparc_dataflow_macro:  Illegal model specified!");
01173       return (0);
01174     }
01175 }
01176 
01177 
01178 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01179 int
01180 M_sparc_subroutine_call (int opc)
01181 {
01182   switch (M_model)
01183     {
01184     case M_SPARC_ELC:
01185     case M_SPARC_VIKING:
01186       return ((opc == Lop_JSR) || (opc == Lop_JSR_FS) ||
01187               (opc == Lop_REM) || (opc == Lop_REM_U));
01188     default:
01189       M_assert (0, "M_sparc_subroutine_call:  Illegal model specified!");
01190       return (0);
01191     }
01192 }
01193 
01194 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01195 char *
01196 M_get_macro_name_sparc (int id)
01197 {
01198   switch (id)
01199     {
01200 
01201     case L_SPARC_MAC_ZERO:
01202       return "g0";
01203     case L_SPARC_MAC_G1:
01204       return "g1";
01205     case L_SPARC_MAC_ICC:
01206       return "icc";
01207     case L_SPARC_MAC_ICC0:
01208       return "icc0";
01209     case L_SPARC_MAC_ICC1:
01210       return "icc1";
01211     case L_SPARC_MAC_ICC2:
01212       return "icc2";
01213     case L_SPARC_MAC_ICC3:
01214       return "icc3";
01215     case L_SPARC_MAC_ICC4:
01216       return "icc4";
01217     case L_SPARC_MAC_ICC5:
01218       return "icc5";
01219     case L_SPARC_MAC_ICC6:
01220       return "icc6";
01221     case L_SPARC_MAC_ICC7:
01222       return "icc7";
01223     case L_SPARC_MAC_ICC8:
01224       return "icc8";
01225     case L_SPARC_MAC_ICC9:
01226       return "icc9";
01227     case L_SPARC_MAC_ICC10:
01228       return "icc10";
01229     case L_SPARC_MAC_ICC11:
01230       return "icc11";
01231     case L_SPARC_MAC_ICC12:
01232       return "icc12";
01233     case L_SPARC_MAC_ICC13:
01234       return "icc13";
01235     case L_SPARC_MAC_ICC14:
01236       return "icc14";
01237     case L_SPARC_MAC_ICC15:
01238       return "icc15";
01239     case L_SPARC_MAC_LEAF:
01240       return "$leaf";
01241     case L_SPARC_MAC_CALLEE:
01242       return "$callee_regs";
01243     case L_SPARC_MAC_CALLER:
01244       return "$caller_regs";
01245     case L_SPARC_MAC_ALLOC:
01246       return "$alloc_size";
01247     case L_SPARC_MAC_PRED_BASE:
01248       return "pred_base";
01249     case L_SPARC_MAC_FCC:
01250       return "fcc";
01251     case L_SPARC_MAC_FCC0:
01252       return "fcc0";
01253     case L_SPARC_MAC_FCC1:
01254       return "fcc1";
01255     case L_SPARC_MAC_FCC2:
01256       return "fcc2";
01257     case L_SPARC_MAC_FCC3:
01258       return "fcc3";
01259     case L_SPARC_MAC_FCC4:
01260       return "fcc4";
01261     case L_SPARC_MAC_FCC5:
01262       return "fcc5";
01263     case L_SPARC_MAC_FCC6:
01264       return "fcc6";
01265     case L_SPARC_MAC_FCC7:
01266       return "fcc7";
01267     case L_SPARC_MAC_FCC8:
01268       return "fcc8";
01269     case L_SPARC_MAC_FCC9:
01270       return "fcc9";
01271     case L_SPARC_MAC_FCC10:
01272       return "fcc10";
01273     case L_SPARC_MAC_FCC11:
01274       return "fcc11";
01275     case L_SPARC_MAC_FCC12:
01276       return "fcc12";
01277     case L_SPARC_MAC_FCC13:
01278       return "fcc13";
01279     case L_SPARC_MAC_FCC14:
01280       return "fcc14";
01281     case L_SPARC_MAC_FCC15:
01282       return "fcc15";
01283     case L_SPARC_MAC_RETADDR:
01284       return "o7";
01285     case L_SPARC_MAC_NONLEAF_RETADDR:
01286       return "i7";
01287     case L_SPARC_MAC_CARRY_SET:
01288       return "C_set";
01289     case L_SPARC_MAC_CARRY_CLEAR:
01290       return "C_clear";
01291     case L_SPARC_MAC_NEG_SET:
01292       return "N_set";
01293     case L_SPARC_MAC_NEG_CLEAR:
01294       return "N_clear";
01295     case L_SPARC_MAC_OVERFLOW_SET:
01296       return "V_set";
01297     case L_SPARC_MAC_OVERFLOW_CLEAR:
01298       return "V_clear";
01299     case L_SPARC_MAC_FSR:
01300       return "fsr";
01301     case L_SPARC_MAC_Y:
01302       return "y";
01303 
01304     default:
01305       return "?";
01306     }
01307 }
01308 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01309 /*
01310  * Return true (1) if the instruction is supported in the hardware of the
01311  * processor.  Return false (0) otherwise.
01312  *
01313  * Basically, those are the instructions that are splitted into multiple
01314  * instructions in phase1 of the Sparc code generator and the optimizer
01315  * will avoid generating them.
01316  */
01317 int
01318 M_oper_supported_in_arch_sparc (int opc)
01319 {
01320   switch (opc)
01321     {
01322 
01323     case Lop_NOR:
01324     case Lop_NAND:
01325     case Lop_AND_NOT:
01326     case Lop_OR_NOT:
01327 
01328     case Lop_MUL_ADD:
01329     case Lop_MUL_SUB:
01330     case Lop_MUL_ADD_F:
01331     case Lop_MUL_SUB_F:
01332     case Lop_MUL_ADD_F2:
01333     case Lop_MUL_SUB_F2:
01334     case Lop_MUL_SUB_REV:
01335     case Lop_MUL_SUB_REV_U:
01336     case Lop_MUL_SUB_REV_F:
01337     case Lop_MUL_SUB_REV_F2:
01338       return (0);
01339 
01340     default:
01341       return (1);
01342     }
01343 }
01344 
01345 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01346 int
01347 M_is_stack_operand_sparc (L_Operand * operand)
01348 {
01349   if (L_is_macro (operand) &&
01350       (operand->value.mac == L_MAC_SP ||
01351        operand->value.mac == L_MAC_FP ||
01352        operand->value.mac == L_MAC_LV ||
01353        operand->value.mac == L_MAC_IP ||
01354        operand->value.mac == L_MAC_OP || operand->value.mac == L_MAC_RS))
01355     return (1);
01356 
01357   return (0);
01358 }
01359 
01360 int
01361 M_is_unsafe_macro_sparc (L_Operand * operand)
01362 {
01363   if (!L_is_macro (operand))
01364     return (0);
01365 
01366   if ((operand->value.mac >= L_SPARC_MAC_ICC &&
01367        operand->value.mac <= L_SPARC_MAC_ICC15) ||
01368       (operand->value.mac >= L_SPARC_MAC_FCC &&
01369        operand->value.mac <= L_SPARC_MAC_FCC15))
01370     return (1);
01371 
01372   switch (operand->value.mac)
01373     {
01374     case L_MAC_P0:
01375     case L_MAC_P1:
01376     case L_MAC_P2:
01377     case L_MAC_P3:
01378     case L_MAC_P4:
01379     case L_MAC_P5:
01380     case L_MAC_P6:
01381     case L_MAC_P7:
01382     case L_MAC_P8:
01383     case L_MAC_P9:
01384     case L_MAC_P10:
01385     case L_MAC_P11:
01386       if ((L_is_ctype_flt (operand)) || (L_is_ctype_dbl (operand)))
01387         return (1);
01388       else
01389         return (0);
01390 
01391     case L_MAC_P14:
01392       return (1);
01393 
01394     default:
01395       return (0);
01396     }
01397 }
01398 
01399 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01400 /*
01401  * Returns the number of machine instructions required to implement the
01402  * specified oper in the best case.  It is assumed that this is for
01403  * supported instructions.  A call to M_oper_supported_in_arch should be
01404  * made for abnormal instructions.
01405  *
01406  * Sparc v8 does not support any pre/post increment loads or stores
01407  * instructions.
01408  */
01409 int
01410 M_num_oper_required_for_sparc (L_Oper * oper, char *name)
01411 {
01412   switch (oper->opc)
01413     {
01414     case Lop_LD_PRE_UC:
01415     case Lop_LD_PRE_C:
01416     case Lop_LD_PRE_UC2:
01417     case Lop_LD_PRE_C2:
01418     case Lop_LD_PRE_I:
01419 
01420     case Lop_ST_PRE_C:
01421     case Lop_ST_PRE_C2:
01422     case Lop_ST_PRE_I:
01423 
01424     case Lop_LD_POST_UC:
01425     case Lop_LD_POST_C:
01426     case Lop_LD_POST_UC2:
01427     case Lop_LD_POST_C2:
01428     case Lop_LD_POST_I:
01429 
01430     case Lop_ST_POST_C:
01431     case Lop_ST_POST_C2:
01432     case Lop_ST_POST_I:
01433 
01434     case Lop_LD_PRE_F:
01435     case Lop_LD_PRE_F2:
01436 
01437     case Lop_ST_PRE_F:
01438     case Lop_ST_PRE_F2:
01439 
01440     case Lop_LD_POST_F:
01441     case Lop_LD_POST_F2:
01442 
01443     case Lop_ST_POST_F:
01444     case Lop_ST_POST_F2:
01445       return (2);
01446 
01447     default:
01448       return (1);
01449     }
01450 }
01451 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01452 
01453 int
01454 M_operand_type_sparc (L_Operand * operand)
01455 {
01456   /* If NULL operand pointer, then return MDES_OPERAND_NULL */
01457   if (operand == NULL)
01458     return (MDES_OPERAND_NULL);
01459 
01460   switch (L_operand_case_type (operand))
01461     {
01462     case L_OPERAND_INT:
01463       return (MDES_OPERAND_Lit);
01464 
01465     case L_OPERAND_MACRO:
01466       if (operand->value.mac >= L_SPARC_MAC_ICC &&
01467           operand->value.mac <= L_SPARC_MAC_ICC15)
01468         return (MDES_OPERAND_sparc_icc);
01469       else if (operand->value.mac >= L_SPARC_MAC_FCC &&
01470                operand->value.mac <= L_SPARC_MAC_FCC15)
01471         return (MDES_OPERAND_sparc_fcc);
01472       else
01473         return (MDES_OPERAND_REG);
01474 
01475     case L_OPERAND_REGISTER:
01476       return (MDES_OPERAND_REG);
01477 
01478     case L_OPERAND_CB:
01479     case L_OPERAND_LABEL:
01480     case L_OPERAND_FLOAT:
01481     case L_OPERAND_DOUBLE:
01482     case L_OPERAND_STRING:
01483       return (MDES_OPERAND_Label);
01484 
01485     default:
01486       M_assert (0, "M_operand_type_sparc: Unknown type");
01487       return (0);
01488     }
01489 }
01490 
01491 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01492 
01493 /* Change this before we attempt to perform scheduling */
01494 
01495 int
01496 M_conflicting_operands_sparc (L_Operand * operand,
01497                               L_Operand ** conflict_array, int len,
01498                               int prepass)
01499 {
01500   int right = 0, left = 0, mac_pair;
01501 
01502   if (prepass && (!L_is_macro (operand)))
01503     {
01504       conflict_array[0] = L_copy_operand (operand);
01505       return (1);
01506     }
01507 
01508   if (L_is_macro (operand))
01509     {
01510       switch (operand->value.mac)
01511         {
01512         case L_MAC_P0:
01513         case L_MAC_P1:
01514         case L_MAC_P2:
01515         case L_MAC_P3:
01516         case L_MAC_P4:
01517         case L_MAC_P5:
01518         case L_MAC_P6:
01519         case L_MAC_P7:
01520         case L_MAC_P8:
01521         case L_MAC_P9:
01522         case L_MAC_P10:
01523         case L_MAC_P11:
01524           if (operand->value.mac & 0x1)
01525             {                   /* if odd macro */
01526               if (L_is_ctype_dbl (operand))
01527                 {
01528                   I_punt ("Mac %d: This macro shouldn't be type double!",
01529                           operand->value.mac);
01530                   return (-1);  /* I_punt doesn't return */
01531                 }
01532               else
01533                 mac_pair = operand->value.mac - 1;
01534             }
01535           else                  /* if even macro */
01536             mac_pair = operand->value.mac;
01537 
01538           /* Conflicts with its int type */
01539           conflict_array[0] = L_copy_operand (operand);
01540           conflict_array[0]->ctype = L_CTYPE_INT;
01541 
01542           /* Conflicts with its float type */
01543           conflict_array[1] = L_copy_operand (operand);
01544           conflict_array[1]->ctype = L_CTYPE_FLOAT;
01545 
01546           /* Conflicts with its double type */
01547           conflict_array[2] = L_copy_operand (operand);
01548           conflict_array[2]->ctype = L_CTYPE_DOUBLE;
01549           conflict_array[2]->value.mac = mac_pair;
01550 
01551           /* Assuming only even macros have type double.
01552            * Ex: (mac P0 f2) also conflicts with (mac P1 f) and (mac P1 i)
01553            *     (mac P2 f2)  "     "        "   (mac P3 f) and (mac P3 i)
01554            */
01555           if (L_is_ctype_dbl (operand))
01556             {
01557               conflict_array[3] = L_copy_operand (operand);
01558               conflict_array[3]->ctype = L_CTYPE_FLOAT;
01559               conflict_array[3]->value.mac = operand->value.mac + 1;
01560 
01561               conflict_array[4] = L_copy_operand (operand);
01562               conflict_array[4]->ctype = L_CTYPE_INT;
01563               conflict_array[4]->value.mac = operand->value.mac + 1;
01564               return (5);
01565             }
01566           else
01567             return (3);
01568         default:
01569           conflict_array[0] = L_copy_operand (operand);
01570           return (1);
01571         }
01572     }
01573   else if (L_is_reg (operand))
01574     {
01575       /* int register */
01576       if (L_is_ctype_integer (operand))
01577         {
01578           conflict_array[0] = L_copy_operand (operand);
01579           return (1);
01580         }
01581       else if (L_is_ctype_flt (operand) || L_is_ctype_dbl (operand))
01582         {
01583           if (operand->value.r & 0x1)
01584             {
01585               /* right side of a floating point register */
01586               left = operand->value.r - 1;
01587               right = operand->value.r;
01588             }
01589           else
01590             {
01591               /* left side of a floating point register */
01592               left = operand->value.r;
01593               right = operand->value.r + 1;
01594             }
01595         }
01596       else
01597         {
01598           M_assert (0, "Limpact_conflicting_operands: illegal reg number");
01599         }
01600     }
01601   else
01602     M_assert (0, "Lsparc_conflicting_operands: unsupported operand type");
01603 
01604   if (L_is_ctype_dbl (operand))
01605     {
01606       /* Set up conflicting double register */
01607       conflict_array[0] = L_copy_operand (operand);
01608       conflict_array[0]->value.r = left;
01609 
01610       /* Set up conflicting float register */
01611       conflict_array[1] = L_copy_operand (operand);
01612       conflict_array[1]->value.r = left;
01613       conflict_array[1]->ctype = L_CTYPE_FLOAT;
01614 
01615       conflict_array[2] = L_copy_operand (operand);
01616       conflict_array[2]->value.r = right;
01617       conflict_array[2]->ctype = L_CTYPE_FLOAT;
01618       return (3);
01619     }
01620   else if (L_is_ctype_flt (operand))
01621     {
01622       /* Set up conflicting double register */
01623       conflict_array[0] = L_copy_operand (operand);
01624       conflict_array[0]->ctype = L_CTYPE_DOUBLE;
01625       conflict_array[0]->value.r = left;
01626 
01627       /* Set up conflicting float register */
01628       conflict_array[1] = L_copy_operand (operand);
01629       return (2);
01630     }
01631   else
01632     {
01633       M_assert (0, "M_conflicting_operands_sparc: unsupported operand type");
01634       return (0);
01635     }
01636 }
01637 
01638 int
01639 M_num_registers_sparc (int ctype)
01640 {
01641 
01642   if ((M_model == M_SPARC_ELC) || (M_model == M_SPARC_VIKING))
01643     {
01644       /* Dont know if these numbers are correct, just guesses.. */
01645       switch (ctype)
01646         {
01647         case L_CTYPE_INT:
01648           return (32);
01649         case L_CTYPE_FLOAT:
01650           return (32);
01651         case L_CTYPE_DOUBLE:
01652           return (16);
01653         default:
01654           return (0);
01655         }
01656     }
01657   else
01658     {
01659       M_assert (0, "M_num_registers_sparc: unsupported model");
01660       return (0);
01661     }
01662 }
